title: FIG AND APPLE CHUTNEY
directions: Peel, core and finely dice the apples and put into a large, heavy-based pan. Stir in the onion, figs, prunes, vinegar, sugar, chilli, ginger and nutmeg.

Put pan over a low-medium hob heat and cook, stirring frequently, to warm the mixture through and dissolve the sugar, about 5min. Turn up the heat to medium and simmer uncovered for about 45min, stirring regularly â€“ the final mixture needs to be fairly thick.

Stir in the sultanas and cook for a further 5-10min. Ladle into sterilised jars (see Get Ahead tip) and seal. Allow to cool completely, and ideally set aside to mellow for a couple of months before opening. Like this? You'll love...
